intro: Hieracium valentius, commonly known as the golden hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, rough to the touch, and often have a hairy texture. Hieracium valentius is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
